Rails/Haml Print HTML Element if Value Exists

Aug 13, 2011
1 minute read

I am using a breadcrumb gem which is very handy. Its called breadcrumb on rails, I highly recommend you check it out. I had the gem rendering in my application layout file, and even though I didnt have a breadcrumb for certain controller it would still print the html element. My solution was to use a content_tag and an if statement. Below is the snippet.

    # bascially checks if @breadcrumbs has a value and if it does renders the html element and breadcrumb info
    = content_tag(:div, render_breadcrumbs, :class => 'breadcrumbs') if @breadcrumbs
Crafted with <3 by John Otander (@4lpine).
